description:
Accenture is a leading global professional services company that helps the world’s leading businesses, governments and other organizations build their digital core, optimize their operations, accelerate revenue growth and enhance citizen services—creating tangible value at speed and scale.
 
We are a talent and innovation-led company serving clients in more than 120 countries. We combine our strength in technology and leadership in cloud, data and AI with unmatched industry experience, functional expertise and global delivery capability. We measure our success by the 360° value we create for our clients, each other, our shareholders, partners and communities.

This LinkedIn company page is moderated. When engaging with Accenture, we encourage everyone to:

- Use common courtesy and be respectful of others.
- Create your own original content and avoid content that you know to be fraudulent.
- Never repost someone else's copyrighted work, unless you have permission.
- Never post personal, identifying, or confidential information.

We reserve the right to delete comments or posts we deem to be:

- Profane, obscene, inappropriate, offensive, abusive material.
- Spam, repeated comments and commercial messages and personal advertisements.
- Discriminatory or that contain hateful speech of any kind regarding age, gender, race, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender identity or disability.
- Threats; personal attacks; abusive, defamatory, derogatory, or inflammatory language; or stalking or harassment of any individual, entity or organization.
- False, inaccurate, libelous, or otherwise misleading in any way.

updates.text:
🌍 Change is coming at an ever-increasing speed, whether it’s geopolitics, AI or the climate crisis. And it doesn’t matter if you’re a bank or a consultancy company – our businesses and clients are all facing the same megatrends.  
 
We were excited to hear from Julie Sweet, CEO of Accenture, in a series for staff hosted by our CEO Christian Sewing.  
 
There was no shortage of topics to cover, with Julie and Christian sharing their views on global developments, how innovation in AI changes the way we work, and the skill sets that are growing in demand. 
 
We also learnt about Julie’s great passion for life-long learning and her own approach to broadening her knowledge and skills. She also spoke about the role of good leadership in times of change, and the importance of purpose in a company’s culture 💪 
 
Check out some of the highlights in our video ⬇️ 
 
#CEO #Accenture #DeutscheBank

A broad-based business reinvention for net zero is underway. Powerful, next-generation decarbonization levers such as AI and the reinvention of business models will be critical accelerate the journey to net zero. 

Read our latest report to learn how companies can accelerate their progress towards net zero. https://accntu.re/4eprXuf

Did you know the average CIO spends 50% of their time on tactical tasks like maintenance? A #DigitalCore can change that by transforming IT into a unified, strategic driver that’s ready to adopt and scale new technologies as they arrive.

Discover the steps to design, build, and operate a unique, reinvention-ready digital core for your business: https://accntu.re/3CoGtoK

[Video Description: Black lines create a geometric pattern over a gradient background. Text animates in the middle of the frame that reads: “How does developing a reinvention-ready digital core make a difference?” The Accenture Greater Than logo appears below the text. A black background fills the frame and text reads: “As one part of the digital core improves, so will others.” The text disappears, and the digital core capabilities appear in a list from the top of the frame to the bottom; it reads: “Digital Platforms, AI, Data, Security, Continuum Control Plane, Composable Integration, Cloud-First Infrastructure” Lines appear next to each capability. The lines begin to move and become intertwined with each other. Text comes on frame that reads: “And as the digital core gets stronger, it makes AI adoption easier. The adoption of AI speeds up the development of digital core capabilities even more.” The lines begin moving quicker, then they create a circle around text that reads: “It creates a virtuous cycle we call the technology halo effect.” A purple Accenture Greater Than logo appears below the text.]

What have we been up to?
 
From participating in the Ascension Charity Classic and shining at L'ATTITUDE in the US, to engaging in the Dual Student Program in Germany, showcasing Automotive Excellence at South Africa Auto Week, sharing innovative ideas at SXSW Sydney in Australia and running together in the Ekiden relay in Belgium, we’ve been busy!
 
And we can't forget celebrating the recognition of Latvia and Lithuania as Great Places to Work and enjoying World Coffee Day in Denmark. 💜 ✨

[Image Description:
Frame 1: Three Accenture employees are posing for a selfie with a blue phone, all smiling against a white backdrop that reads L'attitude.
Frame 2: Eight Accenture employees in purple shirts are posing with a sign that reads "Ascension Charity Classic Youth Clinic presented by Accenture" on a sunny day with blue skies and clean-cut grass.
Frame 3: Three Accenture employees are laughing and drinking coffee while sitting on a blue bench, surrounded by green plants and orange pillows in the background.
Frame 4: The Accenture team is posing for a group photo with their thumbs up after running together in the Ekiden relay in Gallia, with a soccer field in the background.
Frame 5: An aerial view of Accenture employees, all wearing black shirts, standing on cobblestones with their hands in the air, forming the Accenture greater than symbol with their positioning.
Frame 6: A group of performers in orange, green, yellow, black, and blue silky costumes with straw hats is celebrating a Century of Automotive Excellence at SA Auto Week while dancing and playing instruments.
Frame 7: The Platinum Party room at SXSW features the Accenture symbol, illuminated by bright purple lights. The space includes a stage, a podium, and speakers.
Frame 8: A large group of Accenture employees is celebrating the recognition of Latvia and Lithuania as Great Places to Work, with their hands raised in excitement as they receive this award.]

Over 16 million people live in Brazil’s favelas. We want to break their cycle of poverty.
 
Accenture partnered with Gerando Falcões to solve community problems: https://accntu.re/3UF2Z37
 
[Image Description: 
Frame 1:
Across the top of the screen, the Accenture and Gerando Falcões logos sit together, signifying partnership.
Against a black background punctuated by small white dots, a brightly lit favela is composed of purple pointillist dots.
Text on screen explains:
Together, we reinvented the fight against poverty.

Frame 2:
Half of the frame is a continuation of the black background from the previous frame. The other half is white, with text.
Text continues:
By working with Gerando Falcões within Brazil’s favelas to empower women…

Frame 3:
Text on a white background continues:
…giving them a business model to help them sell products, generate income and receive donations…

Frame 4:
A woman and her child smile as they sit together, the mother looking at the child and the child looking at the camera.
Text concludes:
…helping up to 15,000 individuals and their families to rewrite their future.

Frame 5:
Stylized text on a white screen says “REINVENTED WITH accenture” with a purple Accenture “Greater Than” logo.]

Accenture is in the news! This month, some of our leaders shared insights on the growing value of #GenAI for Accenture, the cost of trust erosion for brand marketers, top retail execution strategies for consumer packaged goods (CPGs), the impact of AI in the UK public sector, and the new wave of AI in the workplace.

Check out the full stories:
Julie Sweet on Accenture's fourth quarter and gen AI: https://accntu.re/3Yxdu9U
Saurabh Kumar Sahu on why consumer trust is more critical than ever: https://accntu.re/3AsDN96
Oliver Wright on how CPGs are navigating the current retail landscape: https://accntu.re/4hxDWsq
Shaheen Sayed on how gen AI could help address productivity stagnation in the UK: 
https://accntu.re/3Cc5QKp
Julie Sweet and NVIDIA CEO Jensen Huang on their AI partnership: https://accntu.re/3YwPBiM

[Carousel description: 

Frame 1: The background is purple and has faded text from a news article. Under the Accenture Greater Than logo, text reads: "ACCENTURE IN THE HEADLINES" and below that, it says: ”October 2024”. Underneath, it reads, "Did you catch the news? Leaders say that the UK has more to gain from gen AI than any other G7 nation.” At the bottom, it says, "Catch more highlights" followed by an arrow. 

Frame 2: A graph with neon-colored lines is on the left. To the right of the graph, text reads: “Accenture Chair and CEO Julie Sweet discusses the value of AI for Accenture’s future.” Below the text, CNBC is sourced. At the middle top of the frame is an image of Julie Sweet. 

Frame 3: A quote by Saurabh Kumar Sahu, Managing Director and Lead for Accenture India, is on a white background and reads: “Rapid technology advancements, particularly with accelerated use of AI and generative AI, are reshaping consumers’ digital experiences.” Above the text, Campaign India is sourced. Above the source, various images depict technological advancements. 

Frame 4: A quote by Oliver Wright, Global Consumer Industries Lead at Accenture, is on a white background and reads: “It’s safe to say this is the most complicated landscape we’ve seen today, and we believe it’s only going to get more complicated.” Below the quote, Consumer Goods Technology is sourced. On the bottom, an image depicts AI chatbots. 

Frame 5: Text on a white background reads: “Accenture report finds that generative AI could almost double the UK’s economic growth.” Above the text, Independent is sourced. Above the source, two people are looking at a chart of data. 

Frame 6: Text on a white background reads: “Julie Sweet announces expanded AI partnership with NVIDIA to help companies adopt AI.” To the left of the text, AI chatbots and data are depicted. 

Frame 7: Faded text from a news article is overlaid over a woman looking at her phone. To the right of the woman, text reads: “Click the links in the description above to read more—and follow for more updates.” The Accenture Greater Than logo is at the bottom right.]
